item.title: Tommckee123 add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
Tommckee123 add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "Science is magic that works." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Tommckee123 add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "I felt after I finished Slaughterhouse-Five that I didn’t have to write at all anymore if I didn’t want to. It was the end of some sort of career. I don’t know why, exactly. I suppose that flowers, when they’re through blooming, have some sort of awareness of some purpose having been served. Flowers didn’t ask to be flowers and I didn’t ask to be me. At the end of Slaughterhouse-Five…I had a shutting-off feeling…that I had done what I was supposed to do and everything was OK ." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Tommckee123 add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut Jr.
item.description: "And I urge you to please notice when you are happy, and exclaim or murmur or think at some point, 'If this isn't nice, I don't know what is." -- Kurt Vonnegut Jr.

item.title: Tommckee123 add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "Like so many Americans, she was trying to construct a life that made sense from things she found in gift shops." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Tommckee123 add a quote by kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "As for literary criticism in general: I have long felt that any reviewer who expresses rage and loathing for a novel or a play or a poem is preposterous. He or she is like a person who has put on full armor and attacked a hot fudge sundae or a banana split." -- kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Tommckee123 add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "Do not wait for the last judgment. It comes every day." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Tommckee123 add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "You can't create experience, you undergo it." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Tommckee123 add a quote by Andy Warhol
item.description: "Being born is like being kidnapped. And then sold into slavery." -- Andy Warhol

item.title: Tommckee123 add a quote by Andy Warhol
item.description: "When I look around today, the biggest anachronism I see is pregnancy. I just can't believe that people are still pregnant." -- Andy Warhol
